answerText: "The Raven" [10] This Poe poem speaks of the title maiden who lived in a "kingdom by the sea" but ended up "in a sepulcher."
heading: Collegiate Novice |2012 | 8 | 9 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Answer the following about Edgar Allen Poe's writings, [10]  In this poem by Poe, the narrator ponders "weak and weary" as he hears the title bird "rapping at my chamber door," and is later infuriated by its inability to say anything but "Nevermore."
